column10: Driver going west on Broad St turned without signaling through the crosswalk while a man was in it crossing
column26: 782 N Howard St, Apt 104, Alexandria, VA 22304

column10: Jogging through intersection while W&OD users had to-ahead (cars had red light). A Tesla had stopped in the middle of the crosswalk so was running behind her. She started reversing and almost ran me over. I had to shout and hit her trunk to stop her.

The re-do of the intersection is very unsafe. It allows for cars to turn right from Park onto N West while there is a green signal for the W&OD trail. The right turn is more than 90 degrees and cars come flying around the corner as cyclists and pedestrians are crossing the roadway. This crossing is also used by a lot of children getting out of school. The lights should be re-done to have all red when the trail crossing is green!

After stopping at Great Falls Street, I proceeded into the crosswalk. A school bus in the far lane made no attempt to yield to me (and my daughter) in the crosswalk or a pedestrian crossing from the other side. Most cars slow down at this crossing to ensure they yield to bicyclists and walkers. Some, including this school bus, barrel on through even if people are actively in the intersection.
column21: Stop signs on the W&OD are confusing. Most pedestrians and bicyclists ignore them, contrary to City Ordinance for Falls Church (pedestrians) and City and State Law (for bicyclists). Most drivers treat these crosswalks as YIELD or STOP signs, slowing or stopping even before someone enters the crosswalk. Behavior does not match the signage, leading to confusion and danger when someone behaves atypically (e.g., a bicyclist actually stopping at the stop sign or a bus not slowing down when approaching the crosswalk).

column10: School-aged child attempting to cross the street in the crosswalk; driver did not slow down or stop when turning right onto Virginia from Gundry.  There is no stop sign for drivers in the ""U"" that is Virginia and Gundry.

A motorist with the license plate VUM2670 honked and passed too closely, within about a foot of my bicycle, while passing me. It was too close, unsafe and unlawful. This was on Great Falls St, heading from Lincoln to West St.
column26: 603 W Falls Way, Falls Church, VA 22046
column34: from a Bike Falls Church newsletter

column10: Drivers regularly approach the intersection too fast and threaten pedestrians crossing. On weekdays the problem is from parents dropping off children at Saint James school.
Intersection at Columbia Pike and S Queen St. on multiple occasions drivers coming down the pike heading into DC run the light. We have had several near misses.
Aggressive driver passed me and my daughter (on bikes) on the right in the parking lane. Tailgated us and honked to threaten us before passing.
